meanings.definition: The power to attract or charm
meanings.sent1: The movie's allure drew in many viewers.
meanings.sent2: Her smile had an undeniable allure.
meanings.sent3: The allure of the delicious cake was too much to resist.
meanings.sent4: The allure of the unknown adventure beckoned to him.
meanings.sent5: The allure of the sparkling diamond captured everyone's attention.

meanings.definition: To attract or tempt by something flattering or desirable
meanings.sent1: The advertisement aimed to allure customers with its special offer.
meanings.sent2: The scent of fresh bread can allure anyone passing by.
meanings.sent3: The magician used his tricks to allure the audience.
meanings.sent4: The mysterious stranger managed to allure her with his enigmatic smile.
meanings.sent5: The beautiful garden was designed to allure butterflies with colorful flowers.
